system_prompt: You are a QA Engineer. For each user story I give you, please generate a complete Gherkin feature file with 3-5 realistic, testable scenarios. Please return the Gherkin only, without comments or explanation.

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to click on the address, so that it takes me to a new tab with Google Maps.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: Open address in Google Maps

  Scenario: User clicks on the address link
    Given I am on the webpage with an address displayed
    When I click on the address
    Then a new tab should open with Google Maps displaying the address

  Scenario: User address link is valid
    Given I am on the webpage with a valid address link
    When I click on the address
    Then the new tab should show Google Maps with the correct address

  Scenario: User address link is broken
    Given I am on the webpage with a broken address link
    When I click on the address
    Then I should see an error message indicating the link is broken

  Scenario: User clicks on the address link with popup blocker enabled
    Given I am on the webpage with an address displayed
    And I have a popup blocker enabled
    When I click on the address
    Then I should see a notification that the popup was blocked

  Scenario: User clicks on the address link multiple times
    Given I am on the webpage with an address displayed
    When I click on the address twice
    Then two new tabs should open, each displaying Google Maps with the address
```

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to be able to anonymously view public information, so that I know about recycling centers near me before creating an account.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: Anonymous viewing of public information on recycling centers

  Scenario: User views recycling centers without an account
    Given I am on the recycling information webpage
    When I browse the list of recycling centers
    Then I should see the details of each recycling center without being prompted to create an account

  Scenario: User searches for recycling centers by location
    Given I am on the recycling information webpage
    When I enter my location in the search bar
    Then I should see a list of recycling centers near my location without needing to log in

  Scenario: User attempts to access account features anonymously
    Given I am on the recycling information webpage
    When I try to access account-related features
    Then I should receive a message indicating that I need to create an account to access those features

  Scenario: User views detailed information of a specific recycling center
    Given I am on the recycling information webpage
    And I see a list of recycling centers
    When I click on a specific recycling center
    Then I should see detailed information about that recycling center without needing to log in

  Scenario: User checks for additional resources without an account
    Given I am on the recycling information webpage
    When I look for additional resources related to recycling
    Then I should be able to view resource links without being prompted to create an account
```

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to be able to enter my zip code and get a list of nearby recycling facilities, so that I can determine which ones I should consider.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: Retrieve nearby recycling facilities by zip code

  Scenario: User enters a valid zip code
    Given I am on the recycling facilities webpage
    When I enter a valid zip code into the search field
    And I click on the "Search" button
    Then I should see a list of nearby recycling facilities

  Scenario: User enters an invalid zip code
    Given I am on the recycling facilities webpage
    When I enter an invalid zip code into the search field
    And I click on the "Search" button
    Then I should see an error message indicating the zip code is invalid

  Scenario: User enters a zip code with no nearby recycling facilities
    Given I am on the recycling facilities webpage
    When I enter a zip code that has no nearby recycling facilities
    And I click on the "Search" button
    Then I should see a message stating that no facilities were found near the entered zip code

  Scenario: User leaves the zip code field empty
    Given I am on the recycling facilities webpage
    When I leave the zip code field empty
    And I click on the "Search" button
    Then I should see an error message indicating that the zip code field cannot be empty

  Scenario: User searches for recycling facilities and checks details
    Given I am on the recycling facilities webpage
    When I enter a valid zip code into the search field
    And I click on the "Search" button
    And I select a recycling facility from the list
    Then I should see detailed information about that recycling facility
```

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to be able to get the hours of each recycling facility, so that I can arrange drop-offs on my off days or during after-work hours.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: View hours of recycling facilities

  Scenario: User views hours for a specific recycling facility
    Given I am on the recycling facilities webpage
    When I enter a valid zip code and search for nearby facilities
    And I select a recycling facility from the list
    Then I should see the hours of operation for that recycling facility

  Scenario: User checks hours for multiple recycling facilities
    Given I am on the recycling facilities webpage
    When I enter a valid zip code and search for nearby facilities
    Then I should see the list of recycling facilities with their corresponding hours of operation

  Scenario: User sees hours format
    Given I am on the recycling facilities webpage
    When I enter a valid zip code and search for nearby facilities
    Then the hours of operation should be displayed in a clear and understandable format (e.g., "Mon-Fri: 9 AM - 5 PM")

  Scenario: User views hours for a facility that is closed
    Given I am on the recycling facilities webpage
    When I enter a valid zip code and select a recycling facility that is closed
    Then I should see an indication that the facility is currently closed along with its regular hours

  Scenario: User inquires about holiday hours for a recycling facility
    Given I am on the recycling facilities webpage
    When I enter a valid zip code and select a recycling facility
    And I view the details for that facility
    Then I should see information about any special holiday hours if applicable
```

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to have a flexible pick up time, so that I can more conveniently use the website.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: Flexible pick-up time for recycling services

  Scenario: User selects a pick-up time during scheduling
    Given I am on the recycling pick-up scheduling page
    When I choose a date for pick-up
    And I select a pick-up time from the available options
    Then the selected date and time should be confirmed for my pick-up appointment

  Scenario: User modifies an existing pick-up time
    Given I have an upcoming pick-up appointment scheduled
    When I navigate to the appointment management page
    And I select the option to modify my pick-up time
    And I choose a new pick-up time from the available options
    Then the modification should be saved and I should receive a confirmation of the new pick-up time

  Scenario: User sees available pick-up times
    Given I am on the recycling pick-up scheduling page
    When I enter my zip code and select a date
    Then I should see a list of available pick-up times for that date

  Scenario: User receives a warning for unavailable pick-up time
    Given I am on the recycling pick-up scheduling page
    When I attempt to select a pick-up time that is no longer available
    Then I should see a message indicating that the selected time is not available and I should be prompted to choose another time

  Scenario: User schedules a pick-up with a time outside of operating hours
    Given I am on the recycling pick-up scheduling page
    When I select a date and choose a pick-up time that is outside of operating hours
    Then I should receive a notification that the selected time is not valid and be prompted to select a time within operating hours
```

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to be able to select different types of recyclable waste, so I have and get a list of facilities that accept each type and their opening hours, so that I can find an optimal route and schedule.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: Select types of recyclable waste and find facilities

  Scenario: User selects different types of recyclable waste
    Given I am on the recycling facilities webpage
    When I select multiple types of recyclable waste from the options provided
    And I click on the "Find Facilities" button
    Then I should see a list of facilities that accept the selected types of waste along with their opening hours

  Scenario: User selects only one type of recyclable waste
    Given I am on the recycling facilities webpage
    When I select a single type of recyclable waste
    And I click on the "Find Facilities" button
    Then I should see a list of facilities that accept that specific type of waste and their opening hours

  Scenario: User receives no results for selected recyclable waste types
    Given I am on the recycling facilities webpage
    When I select types of recyclable waste that no facility accepts
    And I click on the "Find Facilities" button
    Then I should see a message stating that no facilities are available for the selected types of waste

  Scenario: User views facility opening hours with waste types
    Given I have selected types of recyclable waste
    When I view the list of facilities that accept those types
    Then I should see each facility's opening hours alongside the accepted waste types

  Scenario: User plans an optimal route based on selected facilities
    Given I have selected types of recyclable waste and found facilities that accept them
    When I view the list of facilities
    Then I should be able to select multiple facilities to plan my route and see their respective opening hours to optimize my schedule
```

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to add donation centers as favorites on my profile, so that I can view them later.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: Add donation centers to favorites

  Scenario: User adds a donation center to favorites
    Given I am logged into my profile on the donation centers webpage
    And I see a list of donation centers
    When I click the "Add to Favorites" button for a specific donation center
    Then that donation center should be added to my favorites list

  Scenario: User views their favorite donation centers
    Given I am logged into my profile
    When I navigate to my favorites section
    Then I should see a list of all donation centers I have marked as favorites

  Scenario: User removes a donation center from favorites
    Given I am logged into my profile
    And I have donation centers saved in my favorites
    When I click the "Remove from Favorites" button for a specific donation center
    Then that donation center should be removed from my favorites list

  Scenario: User tries to add the same donation center to favorites again
    Given I am logged into my profile
    And I have already favorited a specific donation center
    When I click the "Add to Favorites" button for that donation center again
    Then I should see a message indicating that it is already in my favorites

  Scenario: User accesses favorites without being logged in
    Given I am on the donation centers webpage
    When I try to access my favorites section without being logged in
    Then I should be redirected to the login page with a message indicating that I must be logged in to view favorites
```

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to be able to give my email ID, so that I can receive notifications for new events as they are posted.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: Subscribe for email notifications about new events

  Scenario: User successfully subscribes with a valid email ID
    Given I am on the events notification subscription page
    When I enter a valid email ID into the subscription field
    And I click the "Subscribe" button
    Then I should see a confirmation message indicating that I have successfully subscribed to event notifications

  Scenario: User tries to subscribe with an invalid email ID
    Given I am on the events notification subscription page
    When I enter an invalid email ID into the subscription field
    And I click the "Subscribe" button
    Then I should see an error message indicating that the email ID is invalid

  Scenario: User subscribes with an already registered email ID
    Given I am on the events notification subscription page
    And I have already subscribed with a specific email ID
    When I enter that same email ID into the subscription field
    And I click the "Subscribe" button
    Then I should see a message indicating that the email ID is already subscribed

  Scenario: User leaves the email ID field empty
    Given I am on the events notification subscription page
    When I leave the email ID field empty
    And I click the "Subscribe" button
    Then I should see an error message indicating that the email ID field cannot be empty

  Scenario: User receives a notification for new events
    Given I am subscribed to event notifications with a valid email ID
    When a new event is posted
    Then I should receive an email notification regarding the new event
```

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to be able to view a map display of the public recycling bins around my area.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: View map display of public recycling bins

  Scenario: User views the map of recycling bins
    Given I am on the recycling bins webpage
    When I navigate to the map view section
    Then I should see a map displaying public recycling bins in my area

  Scenario: User searches for recycling bins near a specific location
    Given I am on the recycling bins webpage
    When I enter a specific address or location into the search bar
    And I click on the "Search" button
    Then the map should update to show recycling bins near the entered location

  Scenario: User interacts with recycling bin markers on the map
    Given I am viewing the map of recycling bins
    When I click on a marker representing a recycling bin
    Then I should see a popup with details about that recycling bin, including its address and hours of operation

  Scenario: User zooms in and out on the map
    Given I am viewing the map of recycling bins
    When I use the zoom in and zoom out controls on the map
    Then the map should adjust to show more or fewer recycling bins according to the zoom level

  Scenario: User accesses the map on a mobile device
    Given I am on the recycling bins webpage on a mobile device
    When I navigate to the map view section
    Then I should see a responsive map display of public recycling bins around my area
```

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to be able to view the safe disposal events currently being organised around my area.

assistant.content:
```gherkin

    When I enter my location or zip code in the search bar
    And I click the "Search" button
```

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to get feedback when I enter an invalid zip code.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: Feedback for invalid zip code entry

  Scenario: User enters an invalid zip code format
    Given I am on the zip code input page
    When I enter an invalid zip code format (e.g., "1234A")
    And I click the "Submit" button
    Then I should see an error message indicating that the zip code format is invalid

  Scenario: User enters a zip code that is too short
    Given I am on the zip code input page
    When I enter a zip code that is too short (e.g., "123")
    And I click the "Submit" button
    Then I should see an error message indicating that the zip code must be 5 digits long

  Scenario: User enters a zip code that is too long
    Given I am on the zip code input page
    When I enter a zip code that is too long (e.g., "1234567")
    And I click the "Submit" button
    Then I should see an error message indicating that the zip code must be 5 digits long

  Scenario: User submits an empty zip code field
    Given I am on the zip code input page
    When I leave the zip code field empty
    And I click the "Submit" button
    Then I should see an error message indicating that the zip code field cannot be empty

  Scenario: User enters a valid zip code and receives no error
    Given I am on the zip code input page
    When I enter a valid zip code (e.g., "90210")
    And I click the "Submit" button
    Then I should not see any error messages and should proceed to the next step
```

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to be able to create an acocunt, so that I can create my own profile.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: Create an account for user profile

  Scenario: User successfully creates an account
    Given I am on the account creation page
    When I enter a valid username
    And I enter a valid email address
    And I enter a secure password
    And I click the "Create Account" button
    Then I should see a confirmation message indicating that my account has been created successfully

  Scenario: User tries to create an account with an already taken username
    Given I am on the account creation page
    And the username "existingUser" is already taken
    When I enter "existingUser" as my username
    And I enter a valid email address
    And I enter a secure password
    And I click the "Create Account" button
    Then I should see an error message indicating that the username is already taken

  Scenario: User tries to create an account with an invalid email address
    Given I am on the account creation page
    When I enter a valid username
    And I enter an invalid email address (e.g., "invalidEmail")
    And I enter a secure password
    And I click the "Create Account" button
    Then I should see an error message indicating that the email address is invalid

  Scenario: User tries to create an account without filling in all required fields
    Given I am on the account creation page
    When I leave the username field empty
    And I enter a valid email address
    And I enter a secure password
    And I click the "Create Account" button
    Then I should see an error message indicating that all fields are required

  Scenario: User successfully creates an account and receives a welcome email
    Given I am on the account creation page
    When I enter a valid username
    And I enter a valid email address
    And I enter a secure password
    And I click the "Create Account" button
    Then I should receive a welcome email at the provided email address
```

user.content: User story: As an admin, I want to be able to add or remove recycling facilities' information, so that users get the most recent information.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: Manage recycling facilities information

  Scenario: Admin adds a new recycling facility
    Given I am logged in as an admin
    When I navigate to the recycling facilities management page
    And I click the "Add New Facility" button
    And I enter the facility name, address, and operating hours
    And I click the "Save" button
    Then I should see a confirmation message indicating that the facility has been added successfully

  Scenario: Admin removes an existing recycling facility
    Given I am logged in as an admin
    And I am on the recycling facilities management page
    And I see a list of existing recycling facilities
    When I select a facility and click the "Remove" button
    Then I should see a confirmation prompt
    And if I confirm, the facility should be removed from the list and I should see a success message

  Scenario: Admin updates information for an existing recycling facility
    Given I am logged in as an admin
    And I am on the recycling facilities management page
    And I see a list of existing recycling facilities
    When I select a facility and click the "Edit" button
    And I update the facility's address and operating hours
    And I click the "Save" button
    Then I should see a confirmation message indicating that the facility information has been updated successfully

  Scenario: Admin views all recycling facilities
    Given I am logged in as an admin
    When I navigate to the recycling facilities management page
    Then I should see a complete list of all recycling facilities with their details

  Scenario: Admin tries to remove a facility that does not exist
    Given I am logged in as an admin
    When I navigate to the recycling facilities management page
    And I select a facility that does not exist
    And I click the "Remove" button
    Then I should see an error message indicating that the facility could not be found
```

user.content: User story: As an admin, I want to be able to read users' feedback and complaints, so that we can add more features and keep improving the service we provide to them.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: Read users' feedback and complaints

  Scenario: Admin views a list of user feedback and complaints
    Given I am logged in as an admin
    When I navigate to the feedback and complaints management page
    Then I should see a list of all user feedback and complaints submitted

  Scenario: Admin reads a specific user feedback entry
    Given I am logged in as an admin
    And I am on the feedback and complaints management page
    And I see a list of feedback entries
    When I click on a specific feedback entry
    Then I should see the details of that feedback, including the user's comments and any attached files

  Scenario: Admin filters feedback by status
    Given I am logged in as an admin
    When I navigate to the feedback and complaints management page
    And I filter the feedback list by "Pending," "Resolved," or "Archived" status
    Then I should see only the feedback entries that match the selected status

    Given I am logged in as an admin
    And I am viewing a specific user complaint
    When I click on the "Respond" button
    And I enter my response message
    And I click the "Send Response" button
    Then the user should receive my response, and I should see a confirmation message indicating that the response was sent

  Scenario: Admin exports user feedback data
    Given I am logged in as an admin
    When I navigate to the feedback and complaints management page
    And I click the "Export" button
    Then I should receive a downloadable file containing all user feedback and complaints data in a specified format (e.g., CSV, Excel)
```

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to have a great UI and UX from the sites, so that I have a pleasant experience when navigating through them.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: Ensure great UI and UX for the website

  Scenario: User navigates the website with clear structure
    Given I am on the homepage of the website
    When I look for the main navigation menu
    Then I should see clearly labeled sections that guide me to different parts of the site

  Scenario: User experiences quick loading times
    Given I am a user accessing the website
    When I navigate between different pages
    Then each page should load within three seconds to ensure a smooth experience

  Scenario: User finds the website visually appealing
    Given I am on any page of the website
    When I observe the design elements
    Then I should see a cohesive color scheme, readable fonts, and high-quality images that enhance the visual appeal

  Scenario: User interacts with responsive design on mobile
    Given I am accessing the website on a mobile device
    When I resize the browser window or rotate my device
    Then the layout should adjust appropriately for a seamless experience on any screen size

  Scenario: User utilizes accessible features
    Given I am on the website
    When I use accessibility tools or keyboard navigation
    Then I should be able to navigate through all content without barriers, and all elements should be properly labeled for screen readers
```

user.content: User story: As a user, I want to be able to access the site and do all the other stuffs on all of my electronic devices.

assistant.content:
```gherkin

  Scenario: User accesses the website on a desktop computer

    When I enter the website URL in the browser

  Scenario: User accesses the website on a smartphone
    Given I am using a smartphone
    When I enter the website URL in the browser
    Then I should be able to view the website and perform all actions without any functionality loss

  Scenario: User switches devices during a session
    Given I am logged into my account on the website using a desktop
    When I switch to my smartphone
    And I log into my account on the smartphone
    Then I should see the same account information and be able to continue where I left off

  Scenario: User experiences consistent performance across devices
    Given I am using different devices to access the website
    When I perform actions such as searching or submitting forms
    Then the performance and functionality should be consistent across all devices
```

user.content: User story: As an admin, I want to be able to block specific users based on IP address, so that I can prevent spamming on the websites.

assistant.content:
```gherkin
Feature: Block users based on IP address

  Scenario: Admin blocks a specific user by IP address
    Given I am logged in as an admin
    When I navigate to the user management page
    And I enter a specific IP address in the block user field
```
